ml:doc-envelope.ml:original-txt:
ï»¿OFFICIAL e .g o -ac DOCUMENTS RECOMMENDATION OF STATUTORY COMMITTEE TO: The President, International Development Association Recommendation of the Committee under Section 1 (d) of Article V of the Articles of Agreement on the proposed Additional Financing (Lagos Eko Secondary Education Project) to the Federal Republic of Nigeria The undersigned Committee constituted under Section 1 (d) of Article V of the Articles of Agreement of International Development Association (the Association) hereby submits its recommendation pursuant to said Section in respect of the proposal that the Association extend to the Federal Republic of Nigeria (the Recipient) an additional credit in an amount equivalent SDR 27,600,000. The purpose of said credit is to provide additional fund to supplement the original financing provided by the Association under the Financing Agreement for the Lagos Eko Secondary Education Project dated July 20, 2009, between the Recipient and the Association, which aims to improve the quality of public junior and senior secondary education in Lagos State. 1. The Committee has carefully studied the merits of the proposal to extend such an additional financing, and of the purposes to which the proceeds of the additional financing are to be applied. 2. The Committee is of the opinion that the Project in support of which the proceeds of such additional financing are to be applied continues to come within the purposes of the Association as set forth in Article I of said Articles of Agreement, and that the said Project is
ï»¿Federal Republic of Nigeria - 2 - Lagos Eko Secondary Education Project (Additional Financing) designed to promote the economic development of the Recipient and is of high developmental priority in the light of the needs of the Recipient. 3. Accordingly, the Committee finds that said Project continues to merit financial assistance from the Association, and hereby recommends the said Project for such additional financing. COMMITTEE: Senior Vice President and Group General Counsel Nominee selected by Governor for the Federal Republic of Nigeria eli nal Vice President Africa Dated at Washington, DC
